articles.title: Jefferies picks 10 stocks that could benefit from possible Budget 2026 announcements. Do you own any?
articles.summary: Jefferies anticipates the upcoming Union Budget will prioritize defense-led capital expenditure and selective consumption support, with fiscal deficit targets around 4.2% of GDP. The brokerage highlights potential beneficiaries across renewables, real estate, hospitality, and defense sectors, expecting significant growth in defense capex.

articles.title: ‘Will boost confidence of every investor & businessman to invest in India,’ Modi on FTA with Europe
articles.summary: At the inauguration of India Energy Week in Goa, the PM noted that the landmark deal will create major opportunities for people, businesses and investors in both regions.

articles.title: Kochi to host international maritime seminar on Jan 29-30
articles.summary: The event will feature focused panel discussions and technical paper presentations

articles.title: Freight Train Derails In Koraput, Rail Traffic Disrupted For Seven Hours
articles.summary: Following the mishap, restoration work was launched on a war footing.

articles.title: Odisha Bandh On January 28: Congress Backs Farmers’ Stir, BJP Brands It ‘Manufactured Protest’
articles.summary: The farmers’ outfit said the shutdown aims to draw attention to mounting distress among cultivators and the wider public, blaming administrative lapses and rising costs for worsening rural hardships.

articles.title: Budget 2026: A small line item that can have a big impact
articles.summary: This article is authored by Shaveta Sharma-Kukreja, CEO & MD, Central Square Foundation and Ajay Khanna, co-founder, Public Affairs Forum of India (PAFI).

articles.title: Bandhan Bank to lower minimum balance requirement for savings accounts from Feb 1
articles.summary: Bandhan Bank will lower the Monthly Average Balance for Standard Savings Accounts from ₹5,000 to ₹2,000 from February 1, 2026, while maintaining its tiered interest rate structure.

articles.title: UK: Suella Braverman defects from Conservatives to Reform
articles.summary: The former UK Cabinet member is the latest high-ranking Conservative politician to defect to Reform UK, led by Nigel Farage. Another senior Tory, Robert Jenrick, was pushed before he could leave earlier this month.

articles.title: EU Commission Prez announces conclusion of much-anticipated free trade agreement with India
articles.summary: ‘We’ve concluded the mother of all deals. We’ve created a free trade zone of 2 billion people, with both sides set to benefit’, Prez Ursula von der Leyen said in a post on X.

articles.title: 'Very proud of ancestral roots in Goa': European Council chief Antonio Costa flaunts OCI card—watch
articles.summary: European Council President Antonio Costa expressed pride in his Goan roots, highlighting his personal connection to India as the EU and India concluded an ambitious free trade agreement. This historic moment marks a new chapter in their relations, strengthening ties in trade, security, and people-to-people connections.

articles.title: Mint Explainer | Trump, Greenland and the Nato stress test
articles.summary: Trump’s Davos remarks on Greenland have exposed fault lines within Nato, raising questions about the alliance’s credibility, European security, and the future of trans-Atlantic ties.

articles.title: Brazil looks to India to expand trade and cut global dependencies
articles.summary: Reflecting the scale of ambition, the Brazilian Trade and Investment Promotion Agency (ApexBrasil) opens accreditation for up to 200 business leaders to accompany the delegation

Shadowfax lists at 9% discount, still delivers up to 10x gains for early investors
articles.summary: Shadowfax made a muted stock market debut on Wednesday, with its shares listing at a 9% discount to the issue price. Cofounders Abhishek Bansal and Vaibhav Khandelwal, tagged as promoters, hold stakes of 9.28% and 7.22%, respectively, after the public issue. At current prices, their holdings are valued at around Rs 613 crore and Rs 477 crore.

articles.title: Dutch tech giant ASML posts profit gains, eyes bright AI future
articles.summary: Dutch tech giant ASML, which sells cutting-edge machines to make semiconductor chips, reported a significant gain in annual net profit Wednesday and predicted a bright future driven by demand for artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Paytm's founder ownership signals long-term commitment in India's public tech space
articles.summary: Comparative ownership disclosures across listed companies and recent draft filings indicate that Paytm founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma continues to hold one of the highest equity stakes among founders of major Indian tech platforms.

articles.title: SpaceX weighs June 2026 IPO at $1.5 trillion valuation, FT reports
articles.summary: Elon ​Musk's SpaceX ⁠is weighing a mid-June ‌2026 ‌initial public ‌offering, aiming to raise as much ​as $50 billion ​at a ‌valuation ‍of ‍roughly $1.5 trillion, the Financial ‌Times reported, citing people familiar with ‍the matter.

articles.title: Meta campaigns to change opinions on data centers
articles.summary: Meta, OpenAI, Google, Microsoft and Amazon have embarked on a building spree in the AI race, investing hundreds of billions of dollars to erect data centers to develop the technology. In doing so, they have fueled an increasingly political issue, with President Donald Trump and lawmakers across the country criticizing the computing sites for driving up energy costs and straining local water supplies.

articles.title: Shadowfax Technologies shares list at 9% discount on IPO price
articles.summary: Shadowfax Technologies shares began trading on Dalal Street at a discount. The company's IPO saw subdued demand, with grey market premiums turning negative. Institutional investors showed more interest than retail and non-institutional investors. Proceeds will fund expansion and operational scaling. The company operates in e-commerce and hyperlocal delivery.

articles.title: OpenAI's Altman, Apple's Cook become latest CEOs to criticise ICE after Minneapolis killing
articles.summary: Federal agents shot and killed a protester in Minneapolis over the weekend, the second such shooting this month, sparking widespread disapproval of the Immigration and Customs Enforcement's actions. More than 60 CEOs have signed a statement calling ‌for de-escalation after ‌weeks of silence.

articles.title: TikTok faces app deletions, censorship claims, glitches in days after ownership change
articles.summary: Censorship claims, technical problems and a report of a surge in app deletions are just some of the challenges TikTok is facing as it adjusts to a new ownership structure in the United States that was finalized last week.

articles.title: Amazon to close Amazon Go, Amazon Fresh stores, focus on Whole Foods and online grocery delivery
articles.summary: The Seattle-based online retailer said Tuesday in a blog post that it plans to convert some of those soon-to-be shuttered locations into Whole Foods Market stores. The company operates 57 Amazon Fresh stores and 15 Amazon Go stores.

articles.title: Amazon bungles Wednesday layoff plan with misfired internal email
articles.summary: Amazon ‍on Tuesday appeared ​to have mistakenly alerted many Amazon ⁠Web Services cloud computing employees about layoffs planned for Wednesday morning with a commiseration email and ‌team-wide meeting ‌invite sent hours early.

articles.title: DLI 2.0 is targeting six key chip types, 80% local build: Ashwini Vaishnaw
articles.summary: The government is finalising the second phase of the Design-Linked Incentive (DLI) scheme to boost India’s semiconductor capabilities, focusing on six key chip categories and supporting 50 fabless companies. By 2032, India aims to produce advanced 2-3 nm chips and cover 80% of domestic electronic system needs. Annual deeptech awards will also be introduced.

articles.title: Swiggy Q3 Preview: Losses to widen as Instamart investments weigh; revenue may jump 47% YoY
articles.summary: Swiggy is expected to post strong revenue growth of about 47% YoY in Q3FY26, led by steady food delivery demand and a sharp rise in quick commerce. However, continued investments in Instamart, rising competition, and dark store expansion costs are likely to widen losses, with brokerages estimating a Q3 loss in the range of Rs 804–1,045 crore.

articles.title: CarTrade Tech shares slide 11% as investors look past Q3 revenue growth,  margin expansion
articles.summary: CarTrade Tech shares slid sharply after the company reported strong December-quarter profit growth and a significant expansion in margins, with investors focusing instead on a slowdown in revenue growth compared with the prior quarter.

articles.title: Budget, earnings revival crucial to lure FIIs back to India: Punita Kumar Sinha
articles.summary: As India braces for budget week, market watchers are seeking catalysts to lure back cautious foreign institutional investors. Persistent outflows and concerns over earnings trajectory and valuations have weighed on sentiment. However, strategist Punita Kumar Sinha believes pessimism is overdone, highlighting potential positive triggers like the EU trade deal and budget announcements.

articles.title: Vietnam raises $323.8 mln in government bond auction
articles.summary: Vietnam's State Treasury secured 8.44 trillion dong from its latest government bond auction, a dip from the previous week's 12 trillion dong offering. While 58% of bonds were sold, the auction saw no uptake for 5- and 30-year maturities. This brings the year's total government bond sales to 24.4 trillion dong, crucial for funding public investments and economic growth.

articles.title: One 97 Communications Q3 Preview: Paytm parent may post up to 22% YoY revenue growth. Check PAT, margin expectations
articles.summary: Paytm is expected to post another profitable Q3, driven by festive-led demand in payments and financial services. Brokerages forecast a return to year-on-year profitability, around 6% sequential growth, and continued margin expansion, with revenue seen rising up to 22% YoY to about Rs 2,187–2,225 crore.

articles.title: Oil India shares jump nearly 10%, extend gains for second session. What’s behind the surge?
articles.summary: Oil India shares saw a significant jump on Wednesday. This rise followed a sharp increase in global crude oil prices, reaching a four-month peak. Geopolitical tensions, including concerns over US-Iran and Russia-Ukraine conflicts, along with supply disruptions, fueled the market sentiment. Analysts suggest a positive technical outlook for the stock.

articles.title: ONGC shares jump 6% after JV signs shipbuilding deal with Samsung Heavy Industries
articles.summary: ONGC shares rose nearly 6% after its joint venture with Mitsui O.S.K. Lines signed shipbuilding contracts with Samsung Heavy Industries for two ethane carriers, strengthening energy logistics for OPaL and reinforcing bullish valuation and technical indicators.

articles.title: Crypto markets cautious as Bitcoin nears $89,000, Ethereum eyes $3,000
articles.summary: Bitcoin and Ethereum showed cautious optimism, nearing $89,000 and $3,000 respectively, as buyers re-entered key support zones ahead of the Federal Reserve's rate decision. While major altcoins saw significant gains, Bitcoin and Ethereum are expected to trade within consolidation ranges until a clear macro trigger emerges.

articles.title: Digital Real Estate: How Budget 2026 can revive affordable housing, Anuj Puri decodes
articles.summary: India’s housing market risks deepening inequality as affordable supply collapses despite booming luxury sales. With EMIs surging, demand unmet and developers abandoning low-margin projects, Budget 2026 must revive incentives, expand infrastructure, update affordability norms and strengthen subsidies to restore balance and make homeownership achievable for the middle class.

articles.title: Tata Consumer Products shares tumble 5% after Q3. What should investors do?
articles.summary: Tata Consumer Products shares dropped significantly on Wednesday. This occurred even as the company reported a 38% year-on-year profit jump and 15% revenue increase for the December quarter. Analysts from Morgan Stanley, Motilal Oswal, and JM Financial provided their views on the stock. Their recommendations range from Overweight to Buy and ADD, with varying price targets.

articles.title: Silver soars Rs 21,400, nears Rs 4 lakh mark; gold jumps Rs 4,800 to fresh record high. Is it too late to buy?
articles.summary: Gold and silver futures opened higher on Wednesday, January 28, 2026, hitting fresh lifetime highs on the MCX amid strong safe-haven demand and rising geopolitical tensions. Investors now await the US Federal Reserve’s policy decision, with any signal of a rate pause or easing likely to boost market sentiment and support further gains in precious metals.

articles.title: Sunteck Realty Q3 profit rises 34% to Rs 57 cr
articles.summary: Sunteck Realty reported a significant 34 percent jump in its net profit for the third quarter, reaching Rs 56.83 crore. Total income also saw a substantial rise to Rs 356.04 crore. The company's sales bookings increased to Rs 734 crore.

articles.title: Is Budget day overrated? What 15 years of Nifty data reveals about post-Budget trades
articles.summary: Historical Nifty data reveals that investors often miss opportunities by focusing on Budget Day theatrics. The average Budget Day move is minimal, with significant returns typically observed in the week following the event, suggesting patience and waiting for policy clarity is a more profitable strategy.

articles.title: Markets shrug off India-EU trade deal; stock picking key as valuations stay stretched: Deepak Shenoy
articles.summary: Indian markets showed a muted reaction to the India-EU trade deal as investors await clarity on benefits and timelines. Capitalmind CEO Deepak Shenoy says equities remain selectively attractive, with stock-specific opportunities emerging amid valuation pressures, labour law impacts on earnings, rising FMCG competition, and cautious optimism around PSU banks and mid-cap stocks.

articles.title: Aegis Vopak Terminals among three stocks flashing bullish signals; possible uptrend ahead
articles.summary: A White Marubozu is a bullish candlestick pattern in technical analysis that forms when the opening price is the lowest and the closing price is the highest for a given session.

articles.title: Vodafone Idea shares gain over 1% as Q3FY26 losses narrow, ARPU improves
articles.summary: Vodafone Idea shares rose after the telecom operator reported a sharper-than-last-year reduction in consolidated losses for the December quarter (Q3FY26). The company also saw a steady improvement in operating metrics, with ARPU rising 7.3% year-on-year, driven by customer upgrades.

articles.title: Indonesian stocks tumble 7% after MSCI applies interim freeze on investability risks
articles.summary: Indonesia's stock market experienced a sharp 7% drop early Wednesday after MSCI announced a freeze on certain index changes. This decision stems from investor concerns regarding free float data transparency. Indonesian authorities are actively engaged in discussions with MSCI to resolve these issues, aiming to restore market confidence.

articles.title: Vedanta shares up 2%, Hindustan Zinc stock falls after OFS announcement
articles.summary: Vedanta shares rose while Hindustan Zinc slipped after Vedanta approved selling up to 1.59% stake in HZL via a two-day OFS priced at ₹685. With both stocks in overbought territory and valuations mixed, the announcement triggered volatility as markets assessed supply impact and near-term technical risks.

articles.title: Axis Bank among 4 Nifty stocks showing bullish RSI upswing
articles.summary: On January 27, four stocks from the Nifty50 index entered the RSI Trending Up scan after their RSI crossed above the 50 mark from lower levels. This technical development signals improving price momentum and rising buying interest, often tracked by traders to identify potential upside and emerging bullish trends.

TCS CEO K Krithivasan says AI will not trigger mass layoffs: FT report
articles.summary: Speaking to the Financial Times, Krithivasan said he does not expect AI to upend the global outsourcing industry, currently valued at $300 billion, noting that enterprises will continue to rely on large technology vendors to manage complex systems even as automation accelerates.

articles.title: TCS bets $37 million on new Brazil tech campus
articles.summary: The company said the facility will be set up in Londrina, in the southern state of Parana, with an initial investment of about $37 million. The campus is expected to generate more than 1,600 new jobs over time.

articles.title: TI forecasts upbeat quarterly earnings as AI data centers drive analog chip demand
articles.summary: Underscoring the growing importance of AI-driven demand to TI's finances, CEO Haviv Ilan said in a ​post-earnings call on Tuesday that the company would now begin breaking out ​sales to the data center end-market in its results. Revenue in the data center segment grew ‌70% in the December ‍quarter, Ilan said, adding that the segment constituted 9% of total sales in ‍2025.

articles.title: Over 100 Indian AI startup founders moving to US for funds and talent
articles.summary: More than 100 Indian AI founders have moved or are preparing to move to the US, drawn by closer access to customers, capital and the most advanced artificial intelligence ecosystems, despite talk of a reverse brain drain. Composio, Meetstream.ai, Smallest.ai, Beatoven.ai and GetCrux are among startups that have moved base to the US over the past couple of years, while several others are in the process of relocating, investors and founders told ET.

articles.title: India well set to lead AI adoption & growth: Meta senior executive
articles.summary: India is well placed to lead global AI adoption, backed by a large developer base, growing startups, and nearly 800 million internet users, Meta’s Sandhya Devanathan said. She said that the country is central to Meta’s vision for product development and business solutions. She expects an increase in the real-world impact generated by Indian AI startups in 2026.

articles.title: Why a 70:30 India-global portfolio makes sense in a changing world, Subho Moulik decodes
articles.summary: As global markets outperform India, diversification is gaining urgency. Subho Moulik explains why a 70:30 India global portfolio improves risk adjusted returns, reduces concentration risk, and provides access to long term global growth themes such as AI, defence, and quantum computing.

articles.title: F&O Talk | Nifty cracks 5% in 11 days: Is this just the beginning of a deeper slide? Sudeep Shah weighs in
articles.summary: Indian equity markets closed the week on a subdued note, impacted by profit-booking and foreign investor outflows. Global trade concerns and domestic earnings disappointments weighed on sentiment. Analysts suggest caution ahead of the Budget, with Nifty facing resistance and broader markets showing weakness. PSU banks are outperforming private peers.

articles.title: Juspay turns unicorn; Infra.Market IPO gets Sebi nod
articles.summary: Juspay became India's first unicorn of 2026 after a fresh funding round. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: Sensex and Nifty edge modestly higher on easing geopolitical jitters
articles.summary: Indian equities opened marginally higher on Friday, extending a modest recovery after a three-session decline. Gains in Asian markets and easing geopolitical tensions provided some support, but persistent foreign fund outflows and mixed corporate results maintained investor caution.

articles.title: Why New Delhi isn’t losing sleep over the rupee
articles.summary: The Indian rupee is falling as foreign investors withdraw funds and the RBI sells dollars. A trade deal with the US could reverse this trend. India's economy is strong and can absorb higher import costs. The US focus on tariffs may keep oil prices low, aiding India's growth. Washington will eventually reconsider its tariff policy, benefiting the rupee.

articles.title: View: India is cornered by China’s lock on tech
articles.summary: India-China trade: India's industrial growth faces a new challenge as China restricts technology transfers. This impacts key sectors like electric vehicles and energy storage, affecting major Indian conglomerates. Despite recent diplomatic overtures, Beijing's stance highlights a significant technology gap. India's 'Make in India' initiative struggles against this dominance.

articles.title: Sensex falls over 300 pts, Nifty below 25,500 amid trade worries and foreign selling
articles.summary: Indian stock markets continued their downward trend on Tuesday, with both the Sensex and Nifty experiencing a second consecutive session of declines. Investors are closely monitoring global trade uncertainties and ongoing foreign fund outflows, while the quarterly earnings season also captures market attention. The Sensex dropped over 300 points, and the Nifty 50 fell more than 90 points.

articles.title: IT sector poised for better days ahead, financials to outperform: Chakri Lokapriya
articles.summary: Indian equity markets are in a wait-and-watch mode, awaiting clarity on tariffs and the Union Budget's capital expenditure focus. CIO-Equities Chakri Lokapriya highlights selective opportunities in sectors like IT, metals, and banking, while advising caution on insurance and quick commerce due to persistent competitive pressures and margin concerns.

articles.title: PSU banks attractive, domestic demand key; earnings, not valuations, will bring FIIs back: Raamdeo Agrawal
articles.summary: Raamdeo Agrawal, Chairman of Motilal Oswal says PSU banks are among the cheapest opportunities today after years of cleanup. He expects credit growth and domestic demand to drive a multiplier effect, sees earnings picking up over the next year, and warns that excessive valuations—not weak businesses—are behind recent stock corrections.

articles.title: Why fixed-income investors should shift focus from duration to yield in 2026, says Shriram Ramanathan
articles.summary: Indian bond markets are shifting after a strong rally. Investors should now focus on stable returns from attractive yields and selective credit. Aggressive duration bets are less advisable. Opportunities exist in money markets, State Development Loans, and short-term corporate bonds. Currency stability and global developments will also shape investor interest in 2026.

articles.title: Earnings stabilising but valuations still a hurdle for markets: Kotak's Sanjeev Prasad
articles.summary: Kotak Institutional Equities’ Sanjeev Prasad said foreign investor interest may stay weak due to expensive Indian stocks and stronger opportunities in other Asian markets.

articles.title: From Amazon to The Washington Post, Bezos' cost-cutting playbook tightens
articles.summary: Fears of layoffs at Amazon have reached Jeff Bezos-owned newspaper The Washington Post where journalists fear that a similar drive to trim costs could hollow out one of the paper’s core strengths.

articles.title: Stocks that are gaining up to 15% after Q3 results
articles.summary: Several stocks are seeing sharp gains on today, with some rising as much as 15%, after companies reported their Q3 earnings post market hours on Tuesday.

articles.title: Air crashes that killed Indian political leaders: From Sanjay Gandhi to YSR Reddy to Ajit Pawar
articles.summary: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar’s death in a plane crash on Wednesday adds to a grim list of Indian political leaders lost in air disasters over the decades — from former Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani to Haryana minister OP Jindal and Union Minister Madhavrao Scindia.

articles.title: Foreign investors cautious on India amid global rotation and gold rally: Manulife’s Marc Franklin
articles.summary: Marc Franklin, Deputy Head-Multi Asset Solutions-Asia at Manulife Investments, said investor interest in Indian equities could return quickly if global capital flows reverse or momentum in competing asset classes cools, supported by strong underlying fundamentals.

articles.title: What is Bomb cyclone and a polar vortex, and how they form: Explained
articles.summary: A bomb cyclone is a powerful storm that can strengthen very quickly. This happens when cold air and warm air collide, causing the storm's pressure to drop sharply, at least 24 millibars, in just 24 hours.

articles.title: Ajit Pawar plane crash facts and timeline: What we know so far
articles.summary: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar died in a plane crash in Baramati. The plane was a Learjet 45 aircraft that took off from Mumbai at around 8:10 am on January 28. The jet disappeared from radar shortly before 8:45 am.

articles.title: How Ajit Pawar shaped Maharashtra politics: Key milestones and roles
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar, Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister, died in a plane crash near Baramati, ending a decades-long career marked by political influence, finance expertise, and NCP leadership. Baramati was both the beginning and the end of his political journey.

articles.title: Gold, silver prices in India hit all-time highs on strong global cues
articles.summary: Gold and silver prices in India hit all-time highs on MCX, driven by global gains, US policy uncertainty, a weaker dollar, and strong safe-haven and industrial demand, say analysts.

articles.title: Larsen and Toubro wins order worth up to ₹10,000 crore for Riyadh Metro extension
articles.summary: The scope of work includes design and turnkey construction of 8.4km-long metro line, comprising both elevated and underground sections, and five stations, L T said.

articles.title: Apple shares may be rangebound post-earnings. How to use options to wring out profits anyway
articles.summary: Apple has dropped 15% in a month. Nishant Pant suggests an iron condor options strategy ahead of AAPL earnings, targeting the $245 to $265 range for optimal risk reward.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Why skilling must be India’s priority now
articles.summary: As India charts its next phase of growth, skilling must be seen not as a welfare intervention, but as nation-building infrastructure. Just as digital public platforms connected the country, outcome-driven skilling can connect millions to meaningful work and rising incomes, and the Union Budget presents an opportunity to accelerate this momentum, notes NASSCOM Foundation CEO Jyoti Sharma.

articles.title: Flight operations hit in Srinagar, Delhi due to bad weather; airlines issue advisories
articles.summary: A total of 58 flights were cancelled in Srinagar because of the snowfall. Leading carriers including IndiGo, Akasa Air and SpiceJet cautioned passengers about potential delays and disruptions.

articles.title: Remembering Ajit Pawar: Baramati strongman and architect of coalition power
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar, Maharashtra’s Deputy Chief Minister, died at 66 in a plane crash at Baramati. His career spanned major political shifts, controversies, and a split from Sharad Pawar.

articles.title: Ajit Pawar Plane Crash Live Updates: Maharashtra announces 3-day state mourning; CM leaves for Baramati
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar Baramati Plane Crash Live Updates: There were five people on board, including three passengers, one pilot, and one crew member. The aircraft crashed-landed at Baramati during landing near the threshold at Runway 11 at 8:48 am.

articles.title: Ajit Pawar dies in plane crash in Maharashtra's Baramati
articles.summary: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar's plane crashed In Maharashtra's Baramati. There were reportedly five people onboard Ajit Pawar's private plane, including a pilot and a crew, DGCA said.

articles.title: Suzlon Energy shares gain over 3% after 248 MW order win from ArcelorMittal
articles.summary: This is the fourth order for Green Steel that Suzlon Energy has won in the last one year. The said project from ArcelorMittal will be executed in Gujarat's Bachau region.

articles.title: Pinterest to lay off 15% of workforce in global restructuring push toward AI
articles.summary: The cuts are part of a broader transformation effort focused on reallocating resources toward AI-driven roles, prioritising AI-powered products and capabilities, and reshaping its go-to-market strategy.

articles.title: Tata Motors CV shares still have more upside in store; UBS says 'buy'
articles.summary: The Commercial Vehicles unit of Tata Motors does not have any 'sell' recommendation from analysts, while most tracking Ashok Leyland also remain bullish on its prospects.

articles.title: Axis Bank shares gain as JPMorgan upgrades stock, raises target on asset quality beat
articles.summary: Axis Bank confirmed continued positive momentum in retail asset quality stabilisation, with early-bucket delinquencies in the newly originated retail loan book indicating that the improvement in asset quality could continue.

articles.title: India must do more to wind down Russian oil buys, US trade representative says
articles.summary: Jamieson Greer, the US trade representative said that he is in frequent contact with his counterpart in India and shares a great working relationship with him, although a lot more needs to be done on the Russian oil purchase front.

articles.title: Avalanche hits Jammu and Kashmir’s Sonamarg; warnings issued for Uttarakhand too
articles.summary: Uttarkashi, Chamoli and Rudraprayag districts have been placed under ‘orange’ alert, indicating deep and unstable snow cover with a high probability of natural avalanches reaching valley floors.

articles.title: TikTok settles social media addiction lawsuit ahead of trial against Meta, YouTube
articles.summary: TikTok is one of four companies, including Meta, Snap and YouTube, which is a unit of Alphabet-owned Google, facing allegations that their platforms are fuelling a youth mental health crisis.

articles.title: Asian Paints shares drop 6% after downgrade; most analysts remain bearish
articles.summary: CLSA has a price target of ₹1,875 on Asian Paints, which suggests a further downside of 29%. While near-term guidance points to mid-single-digit value growth and high single-digit volume growth, the brokerage said the gap between revenue and volume growth remains a concern.

articles.title: Silver stays near all-time high level: Factors behind metal’s sharp surge
articles.summary: Silver jumped nearly 60% this year to a record $117.69 an ounce, driven by investor demand and the India-EU Free Trade Agreement, experts say.

articles.title: Q3 Results LIVE Updates | Park Medi net profit down 31%; Cartrade Tech shares down 7% post earnings
articles.summary: Q3 Results LIVE Updates: Today promises to be one of the busiest days of the ongoing earnings season. As many as four Nifty companies, along with a whole host of major broader market names, including those from the F O space and the cash markets as well, will be reporting their quarterly results today. The four Nifty companies reporting results today include Maruti Suzuki India, Larsen & Toubro (L T), SBI Life and Bharat Electronics (BEL). Keep an eye on Vodafone Idea, Motilal Oswal for earnings

articles.title: Shadowfax shares make weak debut, list at 9% discount to IPO price
articles.summary: Shadowfax Technologies IPO Listing: The company's ₹1,907 crore initial public offering (IPO) was subscribed 2.86 times on the final day of bidding. The issue received bids for 24.23 crore shares against 8.9 crore shares on offer.

articles.title: Nifty F&O Setup: FII net longs increase marginally for the first time in three months
articles.summary: After two months of decline, net long positions of Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) have seen a marginal increase at the start of the February series, returning back to double digits.

articles.title: Vodafone Idea shares erase early gains as losses persist, subscribers decline in Q3
articles.summary: UBS said it will watch management commentary on ongoing capex and network deployment, progress on the launch of 5G services, updates on the planned debt raise, further developments on AGR dues, and the overall near- to medium-term outlook.

articles.title: Oil prices steady near four-month high on Iran risks and weak dollar
articles.summary: West Texas Intermediate was close to $63 a barrel after rising 2.9% in the previous session to its highest level since early October last year.

articles.title: Asian currencies rise as dollar weakens before Fed
articles.summary: Asian equities were mixed with Japan falling and South Korea rising. The Malaysian ringgit, South Korean won and the Thai baht all appreciated in early Asian trade post the Bloomberg Dollar Spot Index sliding to its lowest since February 2022 during the US session.

articles.title: Hindustan Zinc shares fall after Vedanta announces ₹4,500 crore OFS — All you need to know
articles.summary: Even as Hindustan Zinc shares have rallied towards their record high levels, not many retail investors have benefitted from this, as the stock has very little free float in the market.

articles.title: 'Gold on Steroids' — Citi sees Silver at $150 in the next three months
articles.summary: Citi believes Chinese buying momentum in Silver will continue, and that higher prices will be needed to encourage existing holders to sell.

articles.title: Delhi traffic advisory for Jan 28: Restrictions on these routes for Beating Retreat rehearsals
articles.summary: Delhi Traffic Police will impose restrictions near Vijay Chowk on January 28 from 4 pm to 6 pm for Beating Retreat rehearsals. Commuters should use alternate routes and follow advisories.

articles.title: Amazon email slip reveals planned AWS layoffs
articles.summary: The content of the email reportedly also indicated that those that will be affected by layoffs were notified.

articles.title: Baroda BNP Paribas Money Market Fund crosses ₹4,500 crore in AUM
articles.summary: Baroda BNP Paribas Money Market Fund crossed ₹4,500 crore AUM at six years, outperforming CRISIL Money Market A-I Index with 7.16% return, managed by Vikram Pamnani and Gurvinder Singh.

Just one person, who was hospitalised in Malta, survived the shipwreck, which happened on Friday. Continue reading...

The 44-year-old has been charged with drug trafficking, conspiracy to murder, witness tampering and money laundering, among other charges. articles.title: ‘I lost part of my heart’: last of Japan’s pandas leave for China as ties fray
articles.summary: Hundreds at zoo in Tokyo say farewell to Lei Lei and Xiao Xiao, as China ends ‘panda diplomacy’ with Japan Hundreds of people have gathered to say farewell to two popular pandas departing Tokyo for China, leaving Japan without any of the beloved bears for the first time in 50 years, as ties between the Asian neighbours fray. articles.title: Russian drone strike on Ukrainian passenger train kills five
articles.summary: Attack in Kharkiv region was denounced as terrorism by Volodymyr Zelenskyy, who said it undermined ‘efforts to end the war’ A Russian drone strike on a passenger train in north-eastern Ukraine has killed five people, prosecutors said, an attack denounced as terrorism by president Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Prosecutors said fragments of five bodies had been found at the scene of the strike on the train, which occurred on Tuesday near a village in Ukraine’s Kharkiv region. Continue reading...

Addressing non-trade barriers, such as extensive product sampling, is crucial for India to achieve market leadership in the EU seafood sector.

This move offers a welcome boost to companies like Volkswagen and Renault. While challenges remain from local and Asian rivals, the deal signals a promising future for European exports. India's car market is poised for substantial growth.

articles.title: Entry-level IT salaries have stagnated, says AICC report ahead of Union Budget
articles.summary: The report titled "Real State of the Economy, 2026” said entry-level AI jobs are under threat due to the rise of AI. Youth unemployment touched 15% in September 2025 and 18.4% in urban areas, it said.

articles.title: Trump's use of AI images pushes new boundaries, further eroding public trust: Report
articles.summary: The Trump administration has not shied away from sharing AI-generated imagery online, embracing cartoon-like visuals and memes and promoting them on official White House channels. In response to criticism of the edited image of Levy Armstrong, White House officials doubled down on the post, with deputy communications director Kaelan Dorr writing on X that the "memes will continue".

articles.title: What’s so good (and not so good) about Clawdbot, the viral AI assistant
articles.summary: Clawdbot is an open-source agentic AI assistant that runs locally on users’ computers. Created by PSPDFKit founder Peter Steinberger, this does not merely work as a chatbot, but also takes actions on a user’s behalf such as monitoring emails and calendars, managing files, etc.

articles.title: Blue Machines AI sets new benchmark by engaging in unscripted hour-long debate on national TV
articles.summary: In a groundbreaking national television debut, Indian AI platform Blue Machines AI successfully engaged in a 60-minute unscripted news debate. This historic man-versus-machine contest showcased the AI's ability to handle complex discussions, interruptions, and rapid topic shifts, demonstrating enterprise-grade reliability and governance for India's burgeoning tech sector.

articles.title: India’s longest funicular railway opens at Shri Malanggad, turns two-hour hill climb into 10-minute ride
articles.summary: India’s longest funicular railway at Shri Malanggad is now open, cutting a two-hour climb to a 10-minute ride and improving access for pilgrims and tourists.

articles.title: Duty-free access to EU could unlock $263 billion market for Indian textiles: Commerce Ministry

articles.title: Cheers for import of expensive wines from EU, set to get cheaper in India under FTA
articles.summary: While there will be no duty concessions for wines priced below 2.5 Euros, India's duties on expensive wines from the 27-nation bloc are slated to drop from 150% to 20% in a calibrated manner over a period of 7 years.

articles.title: Defence Budget 2026: Expectations point to double-digit growth, modernisation, drones, missiles, and indigenous manufacturing
articles.summary: Expectations for Defence Budget 2026 indicate double-digit growth, focusing on modernisation, drones, missiles, R D, and indigenous manufacturing to strengthen India’s security amid rising geopolitical challenges.

articles.title: India’s FY27 earnings growth may remain under 10%: Ambit’s Dhiraj Agarwal
articles.summary: Continued earnings downgrades, fading demand, and persistent foreign investor outflows may keep Indian equities under pressure, says Ambit’s Dhiraj Agarwal.

articles.title: Andhra Pradesh pitches ‘speed of doing business’ to global investors at Davos
articles.summary: Andhra Pradesh pitched “speed of doing business” at Davos, highlighting fast-track clearances, deregulation and major tech, AI and renewable energy investments led by Google.

articles.title: AI, not capex, could power India's next growth cycle: PwC sees $550 billion upside by 2035
articles.summary: AI could add $550 billion to India’s economy by 2035, PwC says, positioning artificial intelligence as a system-wide growth lever across five core sectors.

articles.title: TVS Motor Q3 Preview: Strong volumes and mix to drive double-digit revenue growth
articles.summary: TVS Motor is expected to report Q3FY26 earnings on January 28, with standalone profit likely up 59% to ₹982 crore and revenue up 35% to ₹12,323 crore. Strong volumes, favourable product mix, and rupee depreciation are expected to support earnings, while margins are projected to remain above 12.5%. Investors will watch domestic and export demand, ABS implementation, raw material trends, and price actions.

articles.title: Maruti Suzuki Q3 Preview: Healthy volumes, SUVs to boost margins; revenue to grow double-digits
articles.summary: Maruti Suzuki is expected to report Q3FY26 earnings on January 28, with net profit likely up 26% to ₹4,424 crore and revenue up 32% to ₹50,996 crore. Strong volume growth, higher SUV contribution, and better pricing are expected to support revenue and margin, though higher raw material costs and discounts may limit gains.

articles.title: Infosys ties up with Cursor to set up AI software engineering CoE
articles.summary: Infosys partners with Cursor to boost AI software engineering, launching a Center of Excellence and integrating Cursor with Infosys Topaz Fabric to modernise systems for global enterprises. articles.title: Top Stories | India-EU landmark trade deal, stocks rebound, Adani-Airbus deal, and more

articles.title: As Indian savers seek returns beyond FDs, Wint Wealth raises ₹250 crore to offer "FD-plus" without equity risk

articles.summary: Vishal Mega Mart Q3 FY26 net profit rose 19.1% to ₹312.9 crore; revenue up 17%. 29 new stores opened amid strong festive demand and expansion. Shares of Vishal Mega Mart ended marginally higher on Tuesday, January 27, by 0.58% at ₹125.30 on the NSE.
